thread.title: Woman, 22, charged in wrong-way crash that killed off-duty Ridge police officer - Daily Southtown
thread.title_full: Woman, 22, charged in wrong-way crash that killed off-duty Chicago Ridge police officer - Daily Southtown

author: Daily Southtown staff
title: Woman, 22, charged in wrong-way crash that killed off-duty Ridge police officer - Daily Southtown
text:
A 22-year-old west suburban woman has been charged with reckless homicide and aggravated DUI involving death in the wrong-way crash on Interstate 294 that killed off-duty Chicago Ridge Police Officer Steven Smith on Sept. 13, Illinois State Police said.
Sara Lopez, of Bristol, which is just southwest of Aurora, was scheduled to appear in bond court Saturday at the George N. Leighton Criminal Court Building at 2600 S. California Ave., Chicago, Illinois State Police said in a news release Friday.
The preliminary crash investigation indicated Lopez was driving a Toyota southbound in the northbound lanes of I-294 near Cermak Road about 3:45 a.m. when she struck a Dodge head-on.
Smith, 27, a passenger in the Dodge, was pronounced dead at the scene. Lopez suffered non-life-threatening injuries.
Smith was single and had no children. He is survived by his mother, father and brother.
Smith grew up in Chicago Ridge and was a 2007 graduate of Richards High School in Oak Lawn, where he played football. He later served in the Marines and was still a reservist. He became a part-time police officer in October 2010 and went full time in February, Chicago Ridge police said.
